Technologies also offer tools that allow employers and employees to collaborate, communicate, and manage workflow in a streamlined manner. Input: Pangolins, also known as scaly anteaters, are mammals that are covered in protective, overlapping keratin scales. These scales are similar in composition to human nails and can harden over time. Found in Asia and Africa, there are eight extant species of pangolins, with some species threatened with extinction due to poaching and habitat loss. They are solitary animals with a nocturnal lifestyle, primarily feeding on insects such as ants and termites. Using their powerful front claws and long, sticky tongue, they dig into anthills and termite mounds to catch their prey. As they have poor vision, pangolins depend on their strong sense of smell to locate prey. They are known to play a crucial role in controlling insect populations, thus maintaining a balance within their ecosystem.
